alert.note: Alert for Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 07 at 3:32PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Colorado and southeast Colorado, including the Sangre De Cristo mountains, the Wet Mountains and the Wet Mountain Valley, and Fremont and Huerfano counties. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, including burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Monsoon moisture combined with post-frontal upslope winds will increase the risk of heavy rain producing thunderstorms and flash flooding across the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft
